column4: hi all .. i created an ubuntu server that I now need a GUI on .. is there a simple apt-get command to install a GUI?
ok .. gnome is what I'm used to.
apt-get install gnome?
it will
what you want? install gnome3?
just ask your detailed question here
yah, i think so
sorry wrong nick
you are using ubuntu 11.10?
I think so
cat /etc/issue
you are using unity at the moment?
it's a server install in a VM
I think I will create another VM with a GUI instead of downloading the packages .. it is 1.4 GB
sudo apt-get install ubuntu-desktop will bring you gnome3 + unity
but i dont think you need that on a server
if I do a default desktop install, does that include gnome3 + unity
I don't .. but after I installed I realized I want to keep multiple terminals open in my VM so I need X
yes
yes but needing x is different to install complete gnome3 with ubuntu-stuff
tx
you can use ssh to connect to your vm or you can install x
yep .. thanks
